days.title: Arrival in Osaka
days.tagline: Touch down in the chaos‚Äîwelcome to Japan's kitchen
highlights: {'name': 'Arrive Osaka/Kansai (KIX)', 'time': '~15:00-16:00 (afternoon arrival depending on flight)', 'cost': 'Included in international flight', 'notes': 'Collect JR Pass voucher if pre-ordered; exchange at airport'}
{'name': 'Check-in and rest', 'time': '17:00-18:00', 'cost': 'Included in hotel', 'notes': '3 rooms available, modern facilities'}
{'name': 'Dotonbori evening walk', 'time': '18:30-21:00', 'cost': 'Free walking + ~1500 JPY food', 'notes': 'Neon lights, street food, takoyaki, okonomiyaki'}
{'name': 'Dinner at Dotonbori Kiji', 'time': '19:30', 'cost': '~1500-2000 JPY pp', 'notes': 'Famous okonomiyaki, casual, can walk-in'}
transport: Haruka Express from KIX to Namba: ~75 min, ~3070 JPY (covered by JR Pass from day 2)
days.tip: Arrive early; use airport convenience store for IC card (Suica), phone SIM, or WiFi router if not pre-arranged. Sleep well‚Äîyou'll be on jet lag.

days.title: Kyoto: Temple Overload
days.tagline: Golden temples, bamboo forests, and 1000 years of beauty‚Äîall in one day
highlights: {'name': 'Train Osaka‚ÜíKyoto', 'time': '08:00-08:30', 'cost': '~1420 JPY (JR Pass, activate today)', 'notes': '15-min direct train from Osaka Station'}
{'name': 'Fushimi Inari torii gates', 'time': '09:00-11:30', 'cost': 'Free entry', 'notes': '10,000+ red gates, early crowd management, 1.5-2h recommended, can be crowded'}
{'name': 'Kinkaku-ji (Golden Temple)', 'time': '12:00-13:30', 'cost': '400 JPY entry', 'notes': 'Iconic, crowded, perfect reflection photo at midday'}
{'name': 'Lunch at Nishiki Market', 'time': '13:30-14:30', 'cost': '~2000 JPY pp', 'notes': 'Street food sampling, matcha, local specialties'}
{'name': 'Arashiyama Bamboo Forest', 'time': '15:00-16:30', 'cost': 'Free', 'notes': 'Serene, evening light perfect, 30-min walk through grove'}
{'name': 'Tenryu-ji Temple', 'time': '16:30-17:30', 'cost': '800 JPY entry', 'notes': 'Next to bamboo forest, zen gardens, garden reflection'}
food: Breakfast at hotel or convenience store
days.tip: Start Fushimi Inari by 9am to beat crowds. Wear comfortable shoes‚Äîlots of walking. Gion dinner requires reservation if booking in advance.

days.title: Nara & Kyoto: Temples & Deer
days.tagline: Sacred deer roam freely, temples touch the sky, philosophers contemplate riverside
highlights: {'name': 'Train Kyoto‚ÜíNara', 'time': '09:00-09:45', 'cost': '~700 JPY', 'notes': '45 min by JR or Kintetsu line (covered by JR Pass)'}
{'name': 'Nara Deer Park (Nara-koen)', 'time': '10:00-11:30', 'cost': 'Free', 'notes': '1200+ sacred deer, buy crackers (~150 JPY), gentle photogenic experience'}
{'name': 'Todai-ji Temple (Great Buddha)', 'time': '11:30-12:30', 'cost': '600 JPY entry', 'notes': 'Massive bronze Buddha, UNESCO site, awe-inspiring scale'}
{'name': 'Lunch in Nara', 'time': '12:30-13:30', 'cost': '~2000 JPY pp', 'notes': 'Kakinoha-zushi (persimmon leaf sushi) is Nara specialty'}
{'name': 'Train Nara‚ÜíKyoto', 'time': '13:45-14:30', 'cost': '~700 JPY', 'notes': 'Return journey, 45 min'}
{'name': 'Kiyomizu-dera Temple', 'time': '15:00-16:30', 'cost': '400 JPY entry', 'notes': 'Hilltop views over Kyoto, dramatic wooden stage, city panorama'}
days.tip: Deer can be pushy if you have crackers‚Äîdon't buy too many at once. Kiyomizu-dera and Philosopher's Path are best at golden hour. Pack water.

days.title: Hiroshima: Peace & Miyajima
days.tagline: Reflect on history, then float under the world's most photogenic torii
highlights: {'name': 'Shinkansen Kyoto‚ÜíHiroshima', 'time': '08:00-09:30', 'cost': '~11000 JPY (JR Pass covers)', 'notes': '1.5 hours, fast and smooth, breakfast box on board optional (~1500 JPY)'}
{'name': 'Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park', 'time': '10:00-12:00', 'cost': 'Museum 200 JPY', 'notes': 'Moving WWII history, Peace Dome, gardens, allow 2-3 hours'}
{'name': 'Lunch at Ramen Yokocho', 'time': '12:30-13:30', 'cost': '~900-1200 JPY pp', 'notes': 'Local ramen alley, multiple shops'}
{'name': 'Ferry to Miyajima Island', 'time': '14:00-14:30', 'cost': '~190 JPY (JR Pass covers)', 'notes': '15-20 min scenic ferry ride'}
{'name': 'Itsukushima Shrine & Floating Torii', 'time': '14:45-16:30', 'cost': '300 JPY entry', 'notes': 'High tide ideal for gate reflection (check tide tables), iconic red torii, UNESCO site'}
{'name': 'Explore Miyajima island', 'time': '16:30-17:30', 'cost': 'Free', 'notes': 'Souvenir shops, pedestrian streets, local vibe'}
days.tip: Check Miyajima tide tables‚Äîhigh tide (when torii is reflected) is best. Arrive by 3pm to enjoy both day and evening light. Oysters are seasonal autumn-spring; spring ones are tender.

days.title: Fukuoka: Food Capital
days.tagline: One city, infinite flavors‚ÄîFukuoka's food scene is legendary
highlights: {'name': 'Shinkansen Hiroshima‚ÜíFukuoka', 'time': '08:00-09:00', 'cost': '~7000 JPY (JR Pass covers)', 'notes': '1 hour, smooth ride, grab snacks at platform'}
{'name': 'Check-in at hotel', 'time': '09:30-10:30', 'cost': 'Included in hotel', 'notes': 'Beachfront, modern, rest and freshen up'}
{'name': 'Canal City Hakata shopping & exploration', 'time': '11:00-13:00', 'cost': 'Free to walk, shopping varies', 'notes': "Modern mall, restaurants, views, Fukuoka's modern face"}
{'name': 'Lunch at Ichiran Ramen', 'time': '13:00-13:45', 'cost': '~1000 JPY pp', 'notes': 'Tonkotsu ramen (pork bone broth), counter-style, iconic Fukuoka'}
{'name': 'Ohori Park exploration', 'time': '14:00-16:00', 'cost': 'Free', 'notes': 'Beautiful lake park, Fukuoka Castle ruins, gardens, walking paths'}
{'name': 'Rest at hotel before yatai', 'time': '16:00-18:00', 'cost': 'Included', 'notes': 'Relax before evening food stalls'}
food: Breakfast at hotel or convenience store
Yatai evening multi-dish experience (ramen, gyoza, yakitori)
days.tip: Yatai are casual, open-air, standing-room only. Pick a stall with crowds and friendly vibe. Expect to order 2-3 items per person and share. Don't miss gyoza and fried chicken (tori karaage).

days.title: Kumamoto Day Trip
days.tagline: Castle, gardens, and a volcano's edge‚Äîsqueeze it all in before flying south
highlights: {'name': 'Train Fukuoka‚ÜíKumamoto', 'time': '08:30-09:30', 'cost': '~3000 JPY return (JR Pass covers)', 'notes': '45-min Shinkansen or 60-min regular train, choose based on timing'}
{'name': 'Kumamoto Castle exploration', 'time': '10:00-11:30', 'cost': '500 JPY entry', 'notes': 'Recently restored, impressive grounds, cherry blossoms (late April fading but still scenic)'}
{'name': 'Suizenji Garden', 'time': '12:00-13:00', 'cost': '300 JPY entry', 'notes': 'Edo-period garden, miniature Mt Fuji, peaceful, zen aesthetics'}
{'name': 'Lunch near castle', 'time': '13:00-14:00', 'cost': '~2000 JPY pp', 'notes': 'Basashi (horse meat) is Kumamoto specialty if adventurous; otherwise tonkotsu ramen'}
{'name': 'Mt Aso volcanic viewpoint (optional if time)', 'time': '14:30-16:00', 'cost': '~500 JPY', 'notes': '50-min bus ride from Kumamoto; skip if tight on schedule; stunning volcanic landscape'}
{'name': 'Return train to Fukuoka', 'time': '16:00-17:30 (if visiting Mt Aso) OR 14:30-15:30 (if skipping)', 'cost': 'Included in JR Pass', 'notes': 'Head back to hotel for evening'}
transport: Optional bus to Mt Aso: 50 min
food: Hotel breakfast or breakfast at Kumamoto
days.tip: Full day trip is tight but doable. Mt Aso is optional‚Äîonly go if you have 2h buffer and want volcano views. Otherwise, focus on castle and garden for quality experience.

days.title: Flight to Okinawa
days.tagline: Trade mainland temples for subtropical beaches and American heritage
highlights: {'name': 'Morning in Fukuoka (light breakfast)', 'time': '08:00-09:30', 'cost': '~1000 JPY', 'notes': 'Hotel breakfast or quick convenience store meal'}
{'name': 'Travel to Fukuoka Airport', 'time': '09:30-10:15', 'cost': '~300 JPY (local transport)', 'notes': '30 min by airport bus or train from hotel'}
{'name': 'Flight Fukuoka (FUK) ‚Üí Okinawa Naha (OKA)', 'time': '11:00-13:00', 'cost': '~12000 JPY pp (~400 PLN)', 'notes': '2-hour flight, JAL/ANA/Skymark, carry snacks'}
{'name': 'Arrive Naha, check-in', 'time': '13:30-14:30', 'cost': 'Included in hotel', 'notes': 'Hyatt Regency beachfront, luxury, settle in'}
{'name': 'Shuri Castle exploration', 'time': '15:00-16:30', 'cost': '600 JPY entry', 'notes': 'Ryukyu Kingdom history, elevated views of Naha, adjacent to Shikina-en garden'}
{'name': 'Kokusai Street (Main Street) walk', 'time': '16:30-18:00', 'cost': 'Free to walk, shopping varies', 'notes': 'Vibrant shopping, restaurants, Okinawan souvenirs, young energy'}
transport: Naha airport to hotel: ~20 min taxi or bus (~1500 JPY)
days.tip: Arrive in Okinawa afternoon; use it to settle and explore Shuri/Kokusai gently. Sunset at hotel beach is perfect for transition. Okinawa soba is light and refreshing‚Äîideal after flying.

days.title: Okinawa: Islands & Aquarium
days.tagline: Dive into the second-largest aquarium, explore capes, and chase American nostalgia
highlights: {'name': 'Breakfast at hotel or Makishi Public Market', 'time': '08:00-09:00', 'cost': '~1500 JPY', 'notes': 'Market is vibrant, fresh seafood, local energy'}
{'name': 'Okinawa Churaumi Aquarium', 'time': '09:30-12:00', 'cost': '1900 JPY entry', 'notes': 'Massive manta rays, whale sharks, tropical fish, 2nd largest in world, ~2h needed'}
{'name': 'Lunch near Churaumi', 'time': '12:00-13:00', 'cost': '~2000 JPY pp', 'notes': 'Okinawa soba or goya champuru (bitter melon stir-fry)'}
{'name': 'Cape Manzamo scenic viewpoint', 'time': '13:30-14:30', 'cost': '200 JPY entry', 'notes': 'Dramatic cliff formation, East China Sea views, short nature walk'}

{'name': 'American Village (Mihama area)', 'time': '15:00-17:00', 'cost': 'Free to walk, shopping/food varies', 'notes': 'Quirky Americana nostalgia, shops, cafes, Ferris wheel, retro vibes (post-WWII US military influence unique to Okinawa)'}

{'name': 'Optional snorkeling or glass-bottom boat tour', 'time': '17:00-18:30', 'cost': '~3000-5000 JPY pp', 'notes': 'Tropical reef experience, coral, tropical fish (or glass boat if non-swimmers)'}
transport: Churaumi to Cape Manzamo: ~20 min drive
food: Lunch near Churaumi (okinawa soba or goya champuru)
days.tip: Churaumi is must-see. Snorkeling is weather-dependent; glass-bottom boat is safer alternative. American Village is quirky but worth 1h for photo ops. Yunangi dinner is authentic‚Äîarrive 6:30pm to avoid crowds.

days.title: Flight Back & Mt Fuji Gateway
days.tagline: Leave tropical island life, race back to mainland, catch Japan's most iconic peak at sunset
highlights: {'name': 'Breakfast at hotel or nearby cafe', 'time': '08:00-09:00', 'cost': '~1500 JPY', 'notes': 'Light breakfast before early flight'}
{'name': 'Travel to Naha Airport', 'time': '09:00-09:45', 'cost': '~1500 JPY', 'notes': '20-30 min taxi or bus from hotel'}
{'name': 'Flight Okinawa Naha (OKA) ‚Üí Osaka/Kansai (KIX)', 'time': '10:30-12:30', 'cost': '~15000 JPY pp (~500 PLN)', 'notes': '2-hour flight, JAL/ANA, snacks on board'}
{'name': 'Arrive KIX, land and transfer', 'time': '12:45-13:30', 'cost': '~3000 JPY', 'notes': 'Haruka Express or airport bus to Osaka Station'}
{'name': 'Quick lunch in Osaka', 'time': '13:30-14:30', 'cost': '~2000 JPY pp', 'notes': 'Grab box lunch at station or convenience store'}

{'name': 'Train Osaka ‚Üí Kawaguchiko (Mt Fuji area)', 'time': '14:30-18:00', 'cost': '~6000 JPY train + bus (JR Pass covers some)', 'notes': '4.5 hours via limited express Fujiexpress + local bus; scenic route'}
transport: Osaka‚ÜíKawaguchiko train + bus: 4.5h (JR Pass covers limited express; bus may require separate ticket)
days.tip: This is a long travel day. Timed well, you catch sunset over Mt Fuji from Kawaguchiko. Onsen is perfect for sore muscles after 11 days of temples. Fuji Lake Hotel is positioned for sunrise on Day 10‚Äîrest well.

days.title: Mt Fuji: Iconic Views & Lakes
days.tagline: Sacred mountain dawn, mirror lakes, and mountain village charm‚ÄîJapan's zen moment
highlights: {'name': 'Chureito Pagoda sunrise hike', 'time': '06:00-08:00', 'cost': 'Free', 'notes': '1-hour hike to iconic pagoda with Mt Fuji backdrop, start early for sunrise light and clear views (weather dependent)'}
{'name': 'Hotel breakfast', 'time': '08:30-09:00', 'cost': 'Included in hotel', 'notes': 'Return to hotel, refresh, hearty breakfast'}
{'name': 'Lake Kawaguchiko scenic walk', 'time': '09:30-11:00', 'cost': 'Free', 'notes': 'Lakeside promenade, reflections of Fuji (if clear), peaceful morning'}

{'name': 'Oshino Hakkai (eight springs village)', 'time': '11:30-13:00', 'cost': 'Free to walk (some museums 300-500 JPY each)', 'notes': 'Picturesque village with natural springs, traditional architecture, Fuji views'}
{'name': 'Lunch at Oshino', 'time': '13:00-14:00', 'cost': '~2000-3000 JPY pp', 'notes': 'Local houtou noodles or yoshinzushi (local sushi), quiet village vibe'}
{'name': 'Train Kawaguchiko ‚Üí Osaka', 'time': '14:30-18:30', 'cost': '~5000 JPY (JR Pass covers some)', 'notes': '4-hour return journey via limited express, scenic but tiring'}
transport: Hotel to Chureito trailhead: ~15 min taxi or local bus
Walk to Oshino Hakkai: ~20 min bus/taxi from lake
Kawaguchiko‚ÜíOsaka limited express: 4h via scenic route
food: Lunch at Oshino (houtou noodles or sushi)
days.tip: Sunrise hike requires early wake-up; weather is key to Fuji visibility. Oshino Hakkai is peaceful but small; 1h is enough. Return train is tiring but scenic‚Äîbring book/music. Rest well for final days.

days.title: Osaka: Finale & Celebration
days.tagline: Markets, castles, and skyscrapers‚ÄîOsaka's chaotic energy one last time
highlights: {'name': 'Kuromon Market exploration', 'time': '09:00-11:00', 'cost': '~2000-3000 JPY pp for sampling', 'notes': 'Bustling covered market, fresh seafood, sea urchin, scallops, street food sampling'}
{'name': 'Osaka Castle grounds', 'time': '11:30-13:00', 'cost': '600 JPY entry (tower)', 'notes': 'Reconstructed castle, gardens, photo ops, views from tower'}
{'name': 'Lunch at Shinsekai Tanaka', 'time': '13:00-14:00', 'cost': '~2000-3000 JPY pp', 'notes': 'Kushikatsu (fried skewers), vibrant neighborhood, casual energy'}
{'name': 'Shinsekai district walking', 'time': '14:00-15:30', 'cost': 'Free to walk, shopping varies', 'notes': 'Retro arcade, nostalgic streets, vintage vibe, souvenir hunting'}
{'name': 'Rest at hotel', 'time': '15:30-17:30', 'cost': 'Included', 'notes': 'Relax, pack, prepare for farewell dinner'}
{'name': 'Umeda Sky Building at golden hour', 'time': '17:30-19:00', 'cost': '1500 JPY entry (observation deck)', 'notes': 'Modern architectural icon, panoramic city views, sunset experience'}
transport: Walking from hotel to Kuromon Market: 15 min
Subway/bus to Umeda Sky Building: ~20 min
food: Kuromon Market sampling (sea urchin, scallops, etc)
days.tip: Kuromon can be crowded; go early. Osaka Castle tower is worth climbing for views. Umeda Sky Building sunset + farewell dinner is perfect bookend. Adjust dinner timing based on group energy.

days.title: Departure
days.tagline: Safe travels home‚Äîcarrying memories of temples, food, and Japan's heartbeat
highlights: {'name': 'Hotel breakfast (final)', 'time': '08:00-09:00', 'cost': 'Included in hotel', 'notes': 'Last Japanese breakfast'}
{'name': 'Check-out and final shopping (optional)', 'time': '09:00-10:00', 'cost': 'Varies', 'notes': 'Hotel luggage storage available if early checkout needed; final souvenir hunt near hotel'}
{'name': 'Travel to Kansai Airport (KIX)', 'time': '10:00-12:00', 'cost': '~3000-4000 JPY', 'notes': 'Haruka Express 75 min from Osaka Station, or airport bus'}
{'name': 'Airport check-in and immigration', 'time': '12:00-13:30', 'cost': 'Included in flight', 'notes': 'International flight departure procedures'}
{'name': 'Airport shopping & final meal', 'time': '13:30-15:00', 'cost': '~2000-5000 JPY', 'notes': 'Duty-free shopping, airport restaurants, green tea snacks'}
{'name': 'Flight Osaka/Kansai (KIX) ‚Üí Wroc≈Çaw', 'time': '~16:00+', 'cost': 'Included in round-trip', 'notes': 'Return home, ~12+ hour flight with connections'}
transport: Hotel to Osaka Station: 15-20 min walking or taxi
days.tip: Leave hotel by 10am for comfortable airport timing (arrive 3h early for international). Grab green tea kit kats and sake bottles at duty-free. Safe travels!

jrPassAnalysis.note: JR Pass covers mainland trains. Okinawa flights separate.

budget.note: Excluding international flights. Okinawa flights add ~500 PLN pp vs Option A.
